Material used.Description: Differentiated human SH-SY5Y dopaminergic cells overexpressing WT or A53T alpha-synuclein were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Minimal effect on mitochondrial protein expression levels compared to WT alpha-synuclein; only 7 out of 34 identified protein spots significantly differentially expressed in the A53T group.

Biological replicates.Description: Four replicates each of control, A53T, and WT groups in the pH 4-7 range and three replicates in the pH 6-11 range.

Basic positive control.Description: Internal standard prepared by pooling equal quantities of protein extract from each experimental cell type.

Basic negative control.Description: Host SH-SY5Y cells without overexpression of alpha-synuclein used as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA (p < 0.01) across all groups (host, WT, A53T) followed by independent t-tests.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression fold change less than 1.8 or greater than -1.8 compared to control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression fold change greater than 1.8 or less than -1.8 compared to control.

Material used.Description: Mitochondrial extracts from differentiated SH-SY5Y cells expressing WT or A53T alpha-synuclein were analyzed.

Readout description.Result Description: Confirmed altered expression levels of mitochondrial proteins (HSPA9, NDUFS1, DLAT) in A53T alpha-synuclein cells, though effects were less pronounced compared to WT.

Biological replicates.Description: Three consecutive passages of cell extracts were run in parallel for each sample type.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Host control cells used for normalization.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Optical density values calculated as a percentage of the mean signal generated by control cells.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels comparable to mean control group values.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from mean control group values (based on standard deviation).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: OXPHOS Complex I Activity and Quantity Assay

Material used.Description: Mitochondria prepared from triplicate passages of differentiated SH-SY5Y cells expressing WT or A53T alpha-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: Marginally reduced OXPHOS complex I specific activity in A53T overexpressing cell lines compared to host cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Triplicate passages of each cell type analyzed.

Basic positive control.Description: Vector control cells (pcDNA6) used as baseline.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Independent t-tests (threshold at p < 0.05) to determine statistical significance.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: OXPHOS complex I activity comparable to control group mean values.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in OXPHOS complex I activity (p < 0.05) compared to control group.
